page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: The area of our 3km x 4km block of land that we had to study for the Domesday Project lies about 6/8 miles east of the city of Kingston-upon-Hull The main land cover of the area is cultivated farmland with a variety of different sized farms located around the area. There are two main villages in our block, Bilton and Sproatley, and two smaller villages, Wyton and Thirtleby. Bilton is situated on the eastern edge of the city and is almost in danger of being swallowed up by the rapid growth of housing from the city. Sproatley is a quickly growing village with a big estate having been built in the last ten years.It has a few shops, a school and is almost equally placed, 6 miles from the City and 6 miles from the coast.
